SEARCH
Package com.example.chicksevent

Class TEST42_US030301_AdminRemoveImagesUITest

java.lang.Object
com.example.chicksevent.TEST42_US030301_AdminRemoveImagesUITest
public class TEST42_US030301_AdminRemoveImagesUITest extends Object
UI tests for US 03.03.01: As an administrator, I want to be able to remove images. These tests validate that:
  • Administrators can navigate to event admin screen
  • Event posters are displayed in the list
  • Poster images are clickable to remove them
  • Confirmation dialog appears when removing images
  • Images can be removed after confirmation
  • UI updates after image removal
Note: For reliable Espresso testing, disable animations on the device/emulator: 
 adb shell settings put global window_animation_scale 0
 adb shell settings put global transition_animation_scale 0
 adb shell settings put global animator_duration_scale 0
Note: Full end-to-end testing requires:
  • Firebase test data (events with posters)
  • Navigation to EventAdminFragment from AdminHomeFragment
  • Admin user authentication
These tests focus on UI element visibility and basic interactions.

      Test Case 7: Admin can cancel poster removal. As an administrator, I should be able to cancel the removal of a poster by clicking the "Cancel" button in the confirmation dialog.

    • administrator_posterRemoval_updatesUI

      public void administrator_posterRemoval_updatesUI()
      Test Case 8: Poster removal updates UI after confirmation. As an administrator, after confirming poster removal, the UI should update to reflect that the poster has been removed.

      Test Case 9: Multiple posters can be removed sequentially. As an administrator, I should be able to remove multiple posters from different events one after another.

      public void administrator_posterRemoval_showsSuccessMessage()
      Test Case 10: Poster removal shows success message. As an administrator, after successfully removing a poster, I should see a success message (toast) confirming the removal.

    • administrator_eventsWithoutPosters_areDisplayed

      public void administrator_eventsWithoutPosters_areDisplayed()
      Test Case 11: Events without posters can still be displayed. As an administrator, events that don't have posters should still be displayed in the list, just without a poster image.

    • administrator_posterRemoval_worksFromScrollableList

      public void administrator_posterRemoval_worksFromScrollableList()
      Test Case 12: Poster removal works from scrollable list. As an administrator, I should be able to remove posters even if the event list is scrollable and the poster is not initially visible.

    • administrator_confirmationDialog_hasCorrectTitle

      public void administrator_confirmationDialog_hasCorrectTitle()
      Test Case 13: Confirmation dialog has correct title. As an administrator, the confirmation dialog for removing a poster should have the title "Delete Poster".

    • administrator_confirmationDialog_hasDeleteAndCancelButtons

      public void administrator_confirmationDialog_hasDeleteAndCancelButtons()
      Test Case 14: Confirmation dialog has Delete and Cancel buttons. As an administrator, the confirmation dialog should have both "Delete" and "Cancel" buttons for confirming or canceling the removal.

    • administrator_posterRemoval_doesNotAffectEvent

      public void administrator_posterRemoval_doesNotAffectEvent()
      Test Case 15: Poster removal does not affect event deletion. As an administrator, removing a poster should not delete the event itself, only the poster image associated with it.

    • administrator_posterImages_visibleInEventList

      public void administrator_posterImages_visibleInEventList()
      Test Case 16: Poster images are visible in event list items. As an administrator, when viewing the event admin screen, I should see poster images displayed for events that have posters.

    • administrator_posterRemoval_accessibleFromEventAdmin

      public void administrator_posterRemoval_accessibleFromEventAdmin()
      Test Case 17: Poster removal is accessible from event admin screen. As an administrator, I should be able to access poster removal functionality directly from the event admin screen without additional navigation.

    • administrator_posterRemoval_worksAfterScrolling

      public void administrator_posterRemoval_worksAfterScrolling()
      Test Case 18: Poster removal works after scrolling. As an administrator, I should be able to remove posters even after scrolling through the event list.

    • administrator_confirmationDialog_isDismissible

      public void administrator_confirmationDialog_isDismissible()
      Test Case 19: Poster removal confirmation dialog is dismissible. As an administrator, I should be able to dismiss the confirmation dialog by clicking outside it or using the back button.

    • administrator_posterRemoval_maintainsListState

      public void administrator_posterRemoval_maintainsListState()
      Test Case 20: Poster removal maintains event list state. As an administrator, after removing a poster, the event list should maintain its scroll position and other events should remain visible.
